subject: execute code after assertion failure
msgSnippet: Hi, What are the options to ensure that code is executed in a test following an assertion failure? eg: assertEquals( example ,expected,actual); //next line
messageBody:
Hi,

What are the options to ensure that code is executed in a test following an
assertion failure? eg:

assertEquals("example",expected,actual);
//next line should always execute, even upon failure
methodA();

I can use tearDown() or a try/catch/finally block, but I was wondering if
there are any other options.

Thanks,
Nate
